briefTitle: Efficacy and Safety Study of Nicotine Mint Lozenge (2mg and 4mg) in Smoking Cessation

outcomeMeasures.title: Rate of Successful Smoking Cessation at Week 6
outcomeMeasures.description: Rate of Successful Smoking Cessation at Week 6 was measured by Carbon Monoxide (CO) breath levels.

outcomeMeasures.title: Rate of Continuous Successful Smoking Cessation at Week 12 and Week 24
outcomeMeasures.description: Continuous abstinence was verified by measurement of CO breath levels.

outcomeMeasures.title: Rate of Long-term Successful Smoking Cessation at Week 24
outcomeMeasures.description: Rate of long-term successful smoking cessation at Week 24 was defined as the proportion of participants who achieved the primary end-point with no more than six cumulative days of smoking from Week 6 to Week 24.

outcomeMeasures.title: Proportion of Participants With Seven Day Point Prevalence Abstinence
outcomeMeasures.description: Seven day point prevalence abstinence was defined as complete abstinence from smoking for the 7 days up to and including the evaluation day.

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Score of Relief of Craving/ Total Withdrawal Symptoms
outcomeMeasures.description: The evaluation of withdrawal and craving symptoms was carried out every day with the Minnesota Nicotine Withdrawal scale (MNWS). The MNWS total score contains 9 items (urge to smoke; depressed mood; irritability, frustration, or anger; anxiety; difficulty concentrating; restlessness; increased appetite; difficulty going to sleep; difficulty staying asleep). Each item was rated on a 5 grade scale with scores ranging from 0 (best score) to 4 (worst score) i.e. none (score=0), slight (score=1), mild (score=2), moderate (score=3), and severe (score=4). For each symptom at each week, the average score was calculated as the average of the daily scores during that week. The total score was calculated as the sum of the 9 symptoms.

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Daily Dose at Visit 4, 5, 6, 7 and 10
outcomeMeasures.description: Mean daily dose of lozenges was calculated as number of lozenges taken at each visit divided by days since the last visit.

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Body Weight at Week 6, Week 12 and Week 24/ Premature Termination.
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in body weight was analyzed at Weeks 6, 12, and 24.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs), Serious AEs (SAEs), Cardiovascular AEs and Who Discontinued Due to AEs
outcomeMeasures.description: All AEs and SAEs were reviewed and reported by investigator. AEs were graded on a 3-point scale as Mild, Moderate and Severe.
